STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 10, 2025
Shaun Christopher Culp
CALHOUN COUNTY DHHS
190 E MICHIGAN AVE,
BATTLE CREEK, MI, 49014-4005
Re: License #: CP130201006
Dear Shaun Christopher Culp:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/9/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

children in foster home, Supervise

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12205 Required staff
• (8) An agency shall employ or contract for a
sufficient number of competent staff to carry out
the provisions covered by these rules. The
workload for each staff member may not be more
than any of the following:
• (b) Fifteen children assigned to a social
services worker for purposes of providing
direct services in foster care, independent
living, adoption, or post adoption services
or a combination thereof.
One of Seventeen foster care worker caseloads reviewed was over the 15-youth
limit.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
• (a) A written evaluation of a staff member's
performance within a probationary period or
not later than 6 months after the staff
member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation,
2

a written evaluation must be conducted
every 12 months.
One of Three employee files reviewed contained an annual performance evaluation
which was not completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (3) An agency shall record the dates and places of
contacts and persons interviewed or observed as
part of a reevaluation.
Two of Six open foster home files reviewed contained foster home evaluation
reports that did not contain the family's preference related to a youth's SOGIE.
CPA Rule 400.12327 Special evaluation
• (4) Before completion of the written report
required by subrule (6) of this rule, an agency
shall provide the foster parent with a verbal
summary of the preliminary findings at the
conclusion of the evaluation.
One of Six open foster home files reviewed contained a special evaluation report in
which the verbal summary of findings was documented to have been provided prior
to the conclusion of the investigation.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must, include all the following:
• (f) A dental re-examination must be
obtained at least every 9 months, unless a
greater frequency is indicated.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of a periodic dental examination being completed timely.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (2) An agency shall maintain a file documentation
from the medical or dental provider of all medical
and dental care received by a foster child.
3

One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation from medical or dental appointment entered as having been
completed.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (j) Authorization to provide routine and
emergency medical care.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation the caregiver was provided with medical authorization prior to/at
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (2) For an emergency placement, if any of the
information specified in subrule (1)(a) to (h) of this
rule is not available at the time of placement, then
the agency shall provide information to the foster
parent within 7 calendar days of the placement.
Three of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation the caregiver was provided with all required information within 7
days of the emergency placement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Renewal 6/12/2024, CAP Approved 7/22/2024
Interim 6/12/2023, CAP Approval 7/6/2023
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
4

agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation the caregiver was provided and explained three PATP's.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in
the child's placement at least once every month.
One of Eight open files of youth in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation a face-to-face visit was made with the caregiver and youth in the
caregiver’s home in October 2024.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (1) An agency shall document the rationale for
selection of independent living as the most
appropriate placement for the youth.
One of Three open files of youth in independent living placements reviewed did not
contain documentation of how it was determined independent living was the
appropriate placement for the youth.
CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
• (2) All the following must be in the case record
before a youth is placed in independent living:
• (c) That the youth's social service worker
has personally observed and determined
that the living situation is safe, and that the
youth has a bed and has access to cooking
and bathing facilities.
One of Three open files of youth in independent living placements reviewed did not
contain documentation the youth's social service worker viewed and assessed the
independent living placement prior to the youth's placement in the home.
5

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• When completing Section 13 of the CWL-4004 be sure to specify the SOGIE
preferred by the family. Broad statements such as "not willing to accept diverse
SOGIE" in unclear and not specific.
• In a two-parent foster home, the PATP must be provided to and discussed with
both foster parents.
• When reviewing service plans, be sure all case contacts are complete and there
are no partial entries.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided regarding developing a succinct corrective action
plan.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The special evaluation report documented the foster parent was abusing
alcohol while caring for the youths in her home. The report was completed
thoroughly, and the revocation recommendation was appropriate based on the
findings.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP submitted during the period under review was submitted in response to the
2024 licensing renewal inspection. During that inspection, fifteen violations were
established, four of which were MDHHS policy violations no longer regulated by
DCWL. The remaining eleven violations were DCWL rule violations related to
replacement notifications, information provided to new caregiver, overdue
medicals and immunizations, visits with youth, and IL youth documentation. The
Chief Administrator developed and implemented a robust CAP that helped rectify
some of the areas of violation as evidenced by only one violation being repeated
during this year's inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was reviewed and discussed during the
entrance meeting. He indicated the agency has experiences a great deal of
staffing issued over the past several months including the inability to hire needed
6

staff resulting in the need to cross train existing staff and replace them within the
department as needed, as well as multiple staff members going on leave with little
to no notice. The chief administrator also identified staffing performance concerns
that have had to go through a lengthy disciplinary process during which work
quality continues to be lacking. All of these factors have resulted in difficulty
maintaining compliance in all areas despite an effective CAP having been
implemented the previous year.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed reported there have been challenges related to
staffing changes and staff going on leave resulting in workers having to take on
others' cases and quickly assess what needed to be done. They all reported
receiving good support from leadership throughout the hectic changes and being
able to rely on co-workers and supervisors for help with tasks, as needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The office appeared to have adequate space and equipment to provide for the
delivery of foster home certification, foster care, and independent living services.
Files are stored in a secured file room with locked cabinets containing closed
adoption files. The office has no physical CHRI to store.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
June 10, 2025
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 10, 2025

Area Manager
